thread.title: 24 Hours In A&E: Sir John captures the hearts of the nation as the hospital show returned for its 100th episode
thread.title_full: 24 Hours In A&E: Sir John captures the hearts of the nation as the hospital show returned for its 100th episode

title: 24 Hours In A&E: Sir John captures the hearts of the nation as the hospital show returned for its 100th episode
text:
Cars 24 Hours In A&E: Sir John captures the hearts of the nation as the hospital show returned for its 100th episode 24 Hours In A&E: Sir John captures the hearts of the nation as the hospital show returned for its 100th episode 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Hit hospital documentary 24 Hours In A&E returned to our screens tonight for its 100th episode and Britain has very few dry eyes left as a result. 
An at-times heart-wrenching episode saw one man say goodbye to his father, as well as following ten-year-old Niall’s visit to the emergency centre following a nasty fall. 
Here were the main talking points from 24 hours in St George’s Hospital. 
The arrival of a knight of the realm called Sir John Cockburn caused a flurry of jealousy and awe both in the hospital and online, despite his ill health. (Production/The Garden/Channel 4) 
— Sophie Evans (@SeffieKay) October 20, 2015 #24HrsAE how amazing is Sir John's son, wanting to emulate his father by being a gentleman! True love 
— St George's Charity (@GivingtoGeorges) October 20, 2015 You can buy knighthoods on eBay. Right I'm going to work tomorrow as Lord Farquar III. Shouldn't cost much #24hrsAE 
His drinking knowledge, developed through a lifetime working in the wine industry, led to an unconventional upbringing for his son. Wine at aged 8 and cider for breakfast? Adopt me, Sir John! #24HrsAE
